turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Hey, I'm thinking of joining a hackathon, but I'm feeling a bit overwhelmed. I haven't done one before. Any advice?

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Hi there! That's great you're considering a hackathon. They're a lot of fun and a great learning experience. To help me give you the best advice, could you tell me what your main concerns are? Is it team formation, idea generation, technical skills, or something else?

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Ugh, honestly, it's a bit of everything! But I think my biggest worry is the idea. I'm just not very creative when put on the spot. How do people come up with these amazing hackathon projects in such a short amount of time?

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Coming up with ideas quickly is a common challenge! A helpful strategy is to brainstorm *before* the hackathon. Think about problems you encounter in your daily life or areas you're passionate about. Look at the hackathon's themes or sponsors for inspiration. Once you have a few ideas, research existing solutions to see what gaps you can fill or how you can improve upon them. Another strategy can be to leverage existing AI products or services for your project. Does that help?

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Okay, that's actually really helpful! Pre-brainstorming... I hadn't thought of that. But what if someone else has the same idea? Should I just scrap it and start over? That's a time waste!
